字.definition: letter; symbol; character; word; CL:個|个[ge4]; courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

字典.definition: Chinese character dictionary (containing entries for single characters, contrasted with a 詞典|词典[ci2 dian3], which has entries for words of one or more characters); (coll.) dictionary; CL:本[ben3]

字字珠玉.definition: every word a gem (idiom); magnificent writing

字帖兒.definition: piece of paper with short note; short letter

字形.definition: form of a Chinese character; variant of 字型[zi4 xing2]

字數.definition: number of written characters; number of words; word count

字林.definition: Zilin, Chinese character dictionary with 12,824 entries from ca. 400 AD

字根.definition: component of a Chinese character; (linguistics) word root; etymon

字根表.definition: table of components used in wubi input method 五筆輸入法|五笔输入法[wu3 bi3 shu1 ru4 fa3]

字根通用碼.definition: common coding for components of Chinese character; same as Zheng coding 鄭碼|郑码[Zheng4 ma3]

字樣.definition: model or template character; written slogan or phrase; mention (e.g. "air mail" 航空 on a letter, "first draft" 初稿 on a document etc)

字正腔圓.definition: to enunciate beautifully (in speaking or singing) (idiom)

字母詞.definition: word that contains one or more letters of an alphabet (e.g. HSK, PK, WTO, PO文, PM2.5, γ射線|γ射线[γ she4 xian4])

字源.definition: etymology (of a non-Chinese word); origin of a character

字畫.definition: the strokes of a character; calligraphy and painting

字符集.definition: character set (e.g. ASCII 美國資訊交換標準碼|美国资讯交换标准码 or Unicode 統一碼|统一码)

字節跳動.definition: ByteDance, Beijing-based Internet technology company founded in 2012

字紙簍子.definition: see 字紙簍|字纸篓[zi4 zhi3 lou3]

字腳.definition: serif; hook at the end of brushstroke

字號.definition: character size; font size; fame; reputation; shop; name of a shop

字裡行間.definition: between the words and the lines (idiom); implied meaning; connotations

字詞.definition: letters or words; words or phrase

字頭.definition: single-character headword (in a dictionary); first character of a Chinese word; the top part (esp. a radical) of a Chinese character; the initial of a Chinese syllable
